relations.target: water=00069341-v (secrete or form water, as tears or saliva; \""My mouth watered at the prospect of a good dinner\""; \""His eyes watered\"");00228662-v (supply with water, as with channels or ditches or streams; \""Water the fields\"");00453053-v (fill with tears; \""His eyes were watering\"");02362872-v (provide with water; \""We watered the buffalo\"");04569944-n (a facility that provides a source of water; \""the town debated the purification of the water supply\""; \""first you have to cut off the water\"");07951744-n (a liquid necessary for the life of most animals and plants; \""he asked for a drink of water\"");09248053-n (the part of the earth's surface covered with water (such as a river or lake or ocean); \""they invaded our territorial waters\""; \""they were sitting by the water's edge\"");14869913-n (binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent);14871527-n (once thought to be one of four elements composing the universe (Empedocles));14879875-n (liquid excretory product; \""there was blood in his urine\""; \""the child had to make water\""
